user_timeline.tweet: Pres Obama confers with his Asst for Homeland Security & Counterterrorism after arrest tonight of bombing suspect. http://t.co/al1sX2ozwN
Party politics tomorrow for VP Biden. He addresses Michigan Dem Party's 2013 Jefferson-Jackson Dinner at the Cobo Center in Detroit.
Next Friday, Pres Obama holds talks with Jordan's King Abdullah - and he attends the WH Correspondents Dinner next Saturday night.
Also next week: Pres Obama goes to Texas for a Dem fundraiser Wednesday and to attend dedication of George W Bush Center on Thursday.
No public events on Pres Obama's schedule this weekend. Next week: Pres Obama hosts Science Fair on Monday & Teacher of the Year Tuesday.
Pres Obama also signed a Disaster Declaration to help Massachusetts fund repairs in response to winter storm & flooding Feb 8-9.
FEMA now authorized to identify, mobilize, and provide equipment and resources to alleviate emergency in West, Texas.
Pres Obama has issued an Emergency Declaration tonight authorizing federal assistance in response to fertilizer plant in West, Texas.
A weary-looking Pres Obama hails law enforcement capture of 2nd bombing suspect. Photo by Jeff Goldman/CBSNews. http://t.co/RQhkHT8lwd
But this is also the most rapid delivery of a presidential pledge to track down suspects of a heinous attack.
It was also a tough week politically for Pres Obama with the Senate defeat of the gun violence proposals he called for repeatedly.
"All in all this has been a tough week," said Pres. Obama. But he said it showed the character of America.
Pres Obama also reaffirmed support for the victims of the fertilizer explosion in West, Texas.
Pres Obama pledges to provide all the resources at his disposal to find out why the bombings happened and who if anyone helped.
Tonight there are many unanswered questions, says the president. And the families of those killed and those wounded deserve answers.
"We will determine what happened," Pres Obama vows to discover the motives of the Boston Marathon bombers.
Pres Obama hails Boston PD and other State and local police orgs for responding "with bravery and professionalism."
Pres Obama waited till Boston news conference ended on the arrest of the 2nd bombing suspect.
Secy of State Kerry just departed for Turkey, to attend intl conference on aid to opposition groups in Syria. US to pledge some $100million.
US Attorney confirms decision not to give bombing read bombing suspect Miranda rights under public safety exemption.
Pres Obama to make a statement in the  WH Briefing Room at 945pm/ET.
Official tells Lambidakis that official of the High Value Detainee group was on the scene for the arrest.
CBS' Stephanie Lambidakis quotes Justice Dept official: No Miranda warning read to captured suspect. Govt invoking public safety exception.
Tweet from Boston PD: "CAPTURED!!! The hunt is over. The search is done. The terror is over. And justice has won. Suspect in custody."
Boston Mayor Meninon tweets: "We got him."
AMTRAK resuming limited service between NY and Boston tonight. Will return to regular service on Saturday.
"The two leaders agreed to continue...cooperation on counter-terrorism and security issues going forward," said a WH statement.

WH says Pres Obama conferred by phone tonight with Russia's Pres. Putin, who offered his nation's condolences for loss of life in Boston.
INTERPOL says alert asks its 190 members nations to notify US if they've ever come across explosive devices similar to ones used in Boston.
At request of US, INTERPOL issues international security alert called "Orange Notice" for information on bombs like ones used in Boston.

Atty General Holder and FBI Dir Mueller heading to WH to update Pres Obama on the pursuit of the bombing suspects.

Pres & Mrs Obama on way back to DC from Boston visit.
With the approval of Pres Obama, Majority Leader pulling gun bill from the Senate floor. Will return to it at a later date.

The Obamas now at Mass General Hospital visiting with patients, families and staff of those wounded in bombings Monday.
Before the interfaith service, Pres & Mrs Obama visited with the family of Krystle Campbell, 29 year old woman killed in Monday's bombing.
From the Cathedral, Pres Obama crossed street to visit with volunteers from the Boston Marathon, who came to the aid of wounded runners.
Another standing ovation as Pres Obama says this time next year the world will return for the 118th Boston Marathon. "Bet on it!" he says.
Pres Obama decries bombers calling them "small stunted individuals who would destroy instead of build."
"We may be momentarily knocked off our feet, but we’ll get back up...we will finish the race.” says the pres.
Pres gets standing ovation: "it should be pretty clear by now" that those responsible "picked the wrong city to do it. Not here in Boston."
Your resolve is the greatest rebuke to those responsible for the marathon bombings, says the president.
"You will run again. Of that I have no doubt, you will run again," Pres Obama tells people of Boston.
"Boston’s your hometown, but we claim it a little bit too," the President tells Interfaith Service for bombing victims.
Pres Obama: We come together today to reaffirm that the spirit of this city is undaunted and the spirit of this country remains undipped.
Gov Deval Patrick: We will recover and repair, we will grieve our losses and heal. we will rise and endure.
While en route Boston on AF-1, Pres Obama phoned Texas Gov Rick Perry to offer any federal resources in response to disaster in West, Texas.
Other members of MA congressional delegation also given a ride to Boston on AF-1, as was Vickie Kennedy, widow of late Sen Ted Kennedy.
Massachusetts Senators Elizabeth Warren and Mo Cowan flew were guests aboard Air Force One for the flight to Boston & today's service.
Nice line. "We are shaken, but we are not forsaken," said Rev. Nancy Taylor at the Interfaith Service.

15 Democrats voted against amendment to reinstate assault weapons ban. One Republican, Mark Kirk, R-IL., voted for it.
@allan_fabian Any place that serves tater tots.
Pres Obama has arrived at posh Jefferson Hotel for his dinner tonight with 12 Senate Democrats. Follows 2 recent dinners with GOP Senators.
As Pres Obama was speaking, Senate voted 40-60 to defeat amendment to reinstate ban on sale of military-style assault weapons.
Also at the president's side for his statement were parents of five children murdered at Sandy Hook Elementary December 14th.
Pres Obama's sense of defeat reflected in his calling this "a pretty shameful day for Washington."
The Senate vote was a major legislative defeat for Pres Obama, who made 13 speeches on gun violence proposals since Sandy Hook shootings.
Sooner or later we are gonna get this right, says Pres Obama of gun violence bill: "the memories of these children demand it..."
"I see this just as Round One," says the president of the defeat of the background check measure.
Pres Obama says his efforts to reduce gun violence not over. He vows to continue to pursue "meaningful changes."
Pres Obama calls this a "pretty shameful day for Washington."
"Who are we here to represent," says Pres Obama of Senate vote against bill supported by 90% of Americans.
Pres Obama says opponents of the background check measure were worried they'd be painted as anti-2nd Amendment in next election.
Most Senators could offer no good reason to vote against the background check measure, says Pres Obama. “it came down to politics.”
Pres Obama says the gun lobby and its allies "willfully lied" about the gun buyer background check measure.
Pres Obama says the defeated measure showed respect both for gun owners and victims of gun violence.
Pres Obama says "a minority" that included 90% of Republicans blocked background check measure from passage.
Pres Obama flanked by VP Biden, Gabby Giffords and the Barden family as he begins statement on Senate vote.
"We are not going away," says Barden. "Our determination grows stronger."
Barden says he and his family return home "disappointed, but not defeated" by vote against expanded background checks.
Pres Obama being preceded at presidential lectern by Mark Barden, father of 1st grader Daniel killed at Sandy Hook 4 months ago.
GOP alternative background check measure also defeated by failing to reach 60 vote threshold. Senate now voting on assault weapons ban.
Pres Obama to be making his statement on the Senate background check vote to reporters in the Rose Garden shortly.
Giffords made the comments in fundraising message to supporters for her anti-gun violence group: Americans for Responsible Solutions
Giffords, shot in the head 2 years ago, says if Senate refuses to change gun laws "then we need to change the members of the Senate."
Former Rep Gabby Giffords decries Senate for doing the "unthinkable" by defeating gun background check measure.
Cox says NRA will still work with Dems and GOPs who are committed to protecting our children in schools & prosecuting violent criminals.
In statement, NRA's Cox says background check measure would have criminalized some private transfers of firearms between honest citizens.
NRA Exec Dir Chris Cox hails Senate defeat of "misguided" gun buyer background check measure. Says it would not reduce violent crime.
By changing his vote to oppose the background check measure, Majority Leader Reid can bring it back to the floor again.
The 5 Dem Senators voting against background check measure: Baucus/MT, Begich/AK, Heitkamp/ND, Pryor/AR & Reid/NV (for procedural reasons)

When it was stolen, the truckload of equipment had been parked in a motel parking lot in advance of a presidential event nearby.
The stolen gear included microphones, cables, speakers and even the presidential lectern, presidential seal and TelePrompTer.
Yesterday, in Richmond, Va., a federal judge sentenced Eric Brown to 7 years in prison for the theft of the president's audio equipment.
You may recall that in October 2011, a truck load of audio equipment belonging to the White House Communications Agency was stolen.

A word you don't hear much but is spoken at every Medal of Honor ceremony in describing the recipient: intrepidity.
Can't think of any more moving or solemn presidential ceremonies than a Medal of Honor presentation.
Pres Obama presents the Medal of Honor, in a wooden showcase, to Father Kapaun's nephew Ray, born after his uncle died.
Medal citation says Chaplain Kapaun "distinguished himself with acts of gallantry and intrepidity" in the Korean War in November 1950.
Audience in the East Room for the Medal ceremony included former American POWs once held in North Korea like Father Kapaun.
Pres Obama spoke of Father Kapaun's death in a "hell hole" of a death house in the prison campaign, given no food or water.
Pres Obama spoke of the profound care Chaplain (Capt) Kapaun showed for US personnel in a North Korean prison camp in which they were held.
"We honor an American solider who didn't fire a gun," says the Pres., but who put his own life at risk so other soldiers might live.
This is the 11th Medal of Honor Pres Obama has bestowed on his watch, the 6th bestowed posthumously.
Pres Obama says fellow soldiers who served with Chaplain Kapaun in the Korean War "a saint."
At Medal of Honor ceremony, Pres Obama calls the story of Chaplain Emil Kapaun "amazing." Says he was called "a shepherd in combat boots."
First Lady to deliver commencement speeches this season at Eastern Kentucky Univ., Bowie State Univ., & MLK Jr HS in Nashville.

Hatch says Pres Obama is "falsely claiming $1.8-trillion in deficit reduction" and is not the kind of leadership America deserves.
Hatch calls the new Budget "a rehash of the same tax hikes, spending increases and deceptive budget gimmicks."

Also, Obama budget projects next ten years of deficit will total $5.271-trillion.
Obama budget projects National Debt will climb to over $25-trillion over ten years. That's 97% of projected GDP of $26-trillion in 2023.
“The president got his tax hikes in January, we don’t need to be raising taxes on the American people," says Speaker Boehner.
Boehner says Pres Obama deserves "some credit for some incremental entitlement reforms." But he shouldn't hold them hostage for tax hikes.
Speaker Boehner slams Pres Obama's budget for never coming to balance. "You can’t continue to spend money that you don’t have."
If you're serious about deficit reduction, says the pres., there's no excuse to keep tax loopholes open for big corps and wealthy.
